intro: Tirucalia dregeana, commonly known as the African silver tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, silver-gray bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are followed by red, fleshy fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in dry climates. The tree is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some regions.
